p: The species of genus Erythrina, have a great variety of medicinal properties. It has been widely used in folk therapies due to their curare and hypnotic functions and their associated pharmacological effects, including sedatives, hypotensives, neuromuscular blockers, and central nervous system (CNS) depressants [ 16, 17]. Besides, they have been also used to treat microbial infections [ 18], inflammation [ 19], amenorrhea, headache, eye problems, female sterility, liver disorders, asthma, and malaria diseases [ 20, 21, 22].
